title: How to Improve a Dry Cake

steps.headline: Place a thick folded towel over the cake top.
Leave the cake to cool on a wire cooling rack.
steps.description: The towel will trap the escaping steam and force it back into the cake, helping to soften and moisten it again.

steps.headline: Brush a little milk or cold water over the top of the cake.
Place in a medium heat oven (350ºF/ 175ºC) and allow to crisp for 15–20 minutes.
Remove and leave to cool on a wire cooling rack.
Choose a dessert or other sweet fortified wine that you like.
Sprinkle generously over the cake.
steps.description: Or even dip cut pieces of the cake into it.

steps.headline: Make a trifle with the end result.
steps.description: It's a perfect way to save a dry cake.
